faqs.question: What are the entry requirements for studying in Australia?
faqs.answer: International students typically need a valid passport, student visa (subclass 500), proof of English language proficiency, and acceptance letter from an Australian institution.

faqs.question: How much does it cost to study in Australia?
faqs.answer: Tuition fees range from AUD 15,000-35,000 per year depending on the course. Living expenses are approximately AUD 20,000-25,000 per year.

faqs.question: Can international students work while studying?
faqs.answer: Yes, students on a student visa can work up to 20 hours per week during semester and full-time during semester breaks.

faqs.question: What is the climate like in Australia?
faqs.answer: Australia has a generally warm climate. The north is tropical, central areas are arid, and southern regions are temperate with cooler winters.

faqs.question: What visa do I need to study in Canada?
faqs.answer: You'll need a study permit. To qualify, you must have an acceptance letter from a Designated Learning Institution (DLI) and proof of financial support.

faqs.question: What are the tuition fees in Canada?
faqs.answer: International student tuition ranges from CAD 12,000-30,000 per year. Living costs are approximately CAD 15,000-20,000 per year.

faqs.question: Can I work off-campus in Canada?
faqs.answer: Yes, international students can work up to 20 hours per week during studies and full-time during scheduled breaks.

faqs.question: What is the post-graduation pathway?
faqs.answer: Graduates can apply for a Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) valid for up to 3 years depending on study duration.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to study in Europe?
faqs.answer: Requirements vary by country. EU/EEA citizens don't need visas. Non-EU citizens typically need a student visa for the specific country.

faqs.question: How much does education cost in Europe?
faqs.answer: Costs vary significantly. Some countries offer tuition-free programs (Germany, Poland), while others charge EUR 5,000-25,000 per year.

faqs.question: What languages are courses taught in?
faqs.answer: While many universities teach in English, some programs are in local languages. Check individual universities for course availability.

faqs.question: Can I travel within Europe easily?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Schengen Agreement allows visa-free travel across 27 European countries for study breaks.

faqs.question: What visa do I need for the UK?
faqs.answer: You'll need a Student visa (or Doctorate Extension scheme visa). Requirements include: CAS from institution, proof of funds, and English language test results.

faqs.question: How expensive is studying in the UK?
faqs.answer: International student fees range from GBP 12,000-38,000 per year. Living costs in London are approximately GBP 1,300-1,700 monthly.

faqs.question: Are part-time jobs permitted?
faqs.answer: Yes, students can work up to 20 hours per week during term and full-time during holidays, subject to visa conditions.

faqs.question: What qualifications does the UK recognize?
faqs.answer: UK universities recognize qualifications from most countries, but may request additional tests or foundation programs depending on your background.

faqs.question: What is an F-1 visa and how do I get it?
faqs.answer: An F-1 visa is for international students. You need an I-20 form from your university, proof of financial support, and approval from a US university.

faqs.question: How much does it cost to study in the USA?
faqs.answer: Tuition ranges from USD 20,000-60,000+ per year depending on institution. Living expenses are approximately USD 10,000-15,000 per year.

faqs.question: Can international students work?
faqs.answer: On-campus work is permitted up to 20 hours per week. Off-campus work requires special authorization (OPT, CPT).

faqs.question: What is Optional Practical Training (OPT)?
faqs.answer: OPT allows F-1 visa holders to work for up to 12 months (or 29 months for STEM fields) after graduation.

faqs.question: What are the student visa requirements for New Zealand?
faqs.answer: You need an acceptance letter from a New Zealand education institution, proof of financial support (NZD 20,000+), and a valid passport.

faqs.question: How much does it cost to study in New Zealand?
faqs.answer: Tuition fees range from NZD 15,000-25,000 per year. Living expenses are approximately NZD 15,000-20,000 per year.

faqs.question: Can I work while studying?
faqs.answer: Yes, international students can work up to 20 hours per week during studies and full-time during scheduled breaks.

faqs.question: What is the work visa pathway after graduation?
faqs.answer: Successful graduates can apply for a Post-Study Work Visa valid for 1-3 years depending on their qualification level.
